results.title: Spectacular canyons
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Journal Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Natural Phenomena Series”.
Uses diagrams and spectacular photography to introduce the geomorphological agents involved in the creation of canyons. Covers rivers, valleys and glacial valleys showing the processes of weathering and erosion. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Kites: a collage of kites and kite flyers
results.creator_credit: Simon Heaven, Peter R. Jones, Arts Council of Great Britain and Compass Films (UK)
results.brief_description: Shows kites soaring above city heights, wafting across scenic countryside and displaying an array of designs, shapes and multi-tiered constructions. Explores kite mechanics, traditional patterns and characteristics and scientific and other practical applications of these fanciful toys. Includes live footage of kite experiments and archival stills of similarly innovative attempts of the past.

results.title: Indian crafts: Hopi, Navajo and Iroquois
results.creator_credit: Nancy Creedman and BFA Educational Media
results.brief_description: An introduction to the different crafts of three North American Indian tribes. Crafts shown include the weaving of the yucca plant into baskets by the Hopi tribe; the weaving of blankets and the making of silver jewellery by the navajo tribe; and the carving of special masks by the Iroquois tribe from basswood trees.

results.title: Betty Viazim. - Short version.
results.creator_credit: Daro Gunzburg, Elizabeth Knight and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Looks at the life and work of Betty Viazim a milliner who began her apprenticeship at thirteen in 1922 in Sydney. During her career she worked for theatre and film and her creations have featured in productions by the Australian Ballet and others. Also provides a glimpse of Australian working life during the 1920s, 1930s and 1940s.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daro Gunzburg, Elizabeth Knight and Film Australia

results.title: Cyclone warning
results.creator_credit: Brian McDuffie, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A dramatization of the action a community needs to take to prepare for a cyclone in Northern Queensland. Centres on three teenagers, one whose father works on the cyclone warning section of the Bureau of Meteorology. Real life experts in cyclone warnings take part in a critique of the actors’ roles at the end of the film.

results.title: Solomon Island treasures
results.creator_credit: Ian Walker, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Depicts Solomon Islands men and women displaying traditional skills and techniques. Provides an insight into the lifestyle of the people and the myths and legends interpreted in their art.

results.title: Antarctica
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Quantum”.
Explains Australia’s involvement in the setting up of research bases in Antarctica. Major research at the bases is looked at. Shows auroras and cosmic rays research at Mawson as well as Glaciology studies at Casey and animal studies at Davis.

results.title: Solar cells outback
results.brief_description: Deals with applications of the new, cheaper, solar panels to produce electricity in outback Australia beyond the reach of the power grid. The potential of solar powered electric pumps to replace the windpump is also discussed in detail.
results.description: Deals with applications of the new, cheaper, solar panels to produce electricity in outback Australia beyond the reach of the power grid. The potential of solar powered electric pumps to replace the windpump is also discussed in detail.

results.title: Cockatoos at Three Springs
results.brief_description: Filmed at Three Springs, a cockatoo haven in the middle of the Western Australian wheatbelt, this program looks at the characteristics and habits of various cockatoos. Also shows how the erosion of forests in the area to make way for wheat farming affects the lifestyle of the birds in terms of food and shelter.

results.title: Life begins. - Episode 3.
results.brief_description: Illustrates the difference between males and females and explains how conception takes place. Shows a naked family playing on a beach to illustrate how the sexually mature and immature differ. Briefly addresses menstruation.
